results.name: Smallest positive number that requires n steps to be represented as a sum of palindromes using the greedy algorithm.
comment: Index of first occurrence of n in A088601.
Presumably this sequence is unbounded. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 28 2015

The greedy algorithm means iteration of A261424 until a palindrome is reached. For n = 3, 4, ... we have a(n+1) = 10^L(n) + a(n) + 1 with L(n) = 2^(n-2) + 1 = length(a(n))*2 - 3 for n > 3. We have a(7) <= 10^17 + 1000101025, a(8) <= 10^33 + 10^17 + 1000101026, a(9) <= 10^65 + 10^33 + 10^17 + 1000101027, a(10) <= 10^129 + 10^65 + 10^33 + 10^17 + 1000101028, etc, with conjectured equality. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 08 2015, edited Sep 09 2018
link: M. F. Hasler, Sum of palindromes, OEIS wiki, Sept. 2015.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{0 <= k <= n-3} 10^(2^k+1) + n - 82, for n > 2 (conjectured). - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 08 2015
program: (PARI) A109326(n)=if(n>2,sum(k=0,n-3,10^(2^k+1),n-82),10^(n-1)) \\ Based on conjectured formula. Verified to yield an upper bound (i.e., A088601 yields n) for all n < 20. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 09 2015
